metadata.case_name: Union of India & Regional Provident Fund Commissioner v. Ogale Glass Works Ltd.

facts.text: Respondent is Ogale Glass Works Ltd., a limited company with Head Office at Ogalawadi, Satara District, manufacturing Glassware, Stoves, Lanterns and Enamel wares, with sections: Glass Manufacturing, Lantern and Safety Stoves, Enamel, General, and Canteen.
In 1946, Company introduced Provident Fund Scheme paying 12 pies in a rupee as employer's contribution.
In 1951, Provident Fund Scheme amended; Company to contribute only if profits.
Employees' Provident Funds Act, 1952 (Act XIX of 1952) came into force on November 1, 1952, applicable to scheduled industries; applied to respondent on October 6, 1952.
From November 1, 1952, Company paid contributions to Employees' Provident Fund; RPFC held Act applied to entire establishment.
Company objected that only Lantern and Stoves Section covered; RPFC rejected on March 31, 1953, but Company continued contributions for all employees.

Nagpur Glass Works (similar establishment) filed writ; Bombay HC (Nagpur Bench) on March 7, 1957 held Act applies only to sections covered by Schedule I (Lantern/Stoves). Reported as Nagpur Glass Works Ltd. v. Regional Provident Fund Commissioner, I.L.R. 1958 Bom. 444.
December 10, 1957: Company wrote to RPFC citing Bombay HC judgment, requesting reconsideration and refund/adjustment of excess contributions for non-covered sections.
November 28, 1958: RPFC wrote to Company noting it withheld payments pending SC decision; employees' union represented employees' shares collected but not remitted.
December 22, 1958: Company affirmed liability for Lantern/Glass but disputed for Glass, Enamel, others; calculated excess Rs. 1,11,940/- paid, requested adjustment till SC decision.

Employees raised dispute on discontinuance; State Govt referred to Industrial Tribunal, Maharashtra (Ref. I.D. 29 of 1960); Award June 24, 1960: Contributions at reduced rates for certain years based on losses (8-1/3% for 1951,1957-59; 6-1/4% from Mar 1,1960; none for 1950,1952-56); also on DA.
August 19, 1959: Central PF Commissioner to RPFC: Govt advised enamel, lanterns/stoves sections covered; refund contributions for general, glass, canteen sections.
September 21, 1959: RPFC to Company: Act/Scheme apply to Enamel, Lantern/Stoves; refund for other sections; submit list.
October 14, 1959: Central PF Commr to Employees' Union: Coverage discontinued for three sections due to Bombay HC judgment; pending SC appeal.
October 17, 1959: Union objected to decision pending SC appeal.
November 20, 1959: Company submitted accounts for refund.
April 20, 1960: RPFC informed Company of refunds.
March 14, 1962: SC reversed Bombay HC in Regional Provident Fund Commr v. Shree Krishna Metal Mfg Co., 1962 Supp (3) SCR 815; Act applies to composite factories.
March 22, 1963: RPFC demanded contributions Nov 1,1952-Dec 31,1960 + admin charges.
May 22, 1963: RPFC notice of demand for contributions + admin charges Nov 1,1952-Dec 31,1960.
Company protested citing S.19A decision, Tribunal award, and disputed applicability.
Special Civil Appln No. 380/1964 filed by Company under Art.226; Bombay HC (Sep 17,1965) allowed, quashed May 22,1963 demand, holding S.19A decision final.
Appeal to SC on certificate.

legal_issues.text: Whether there has been a decision of the Central Government under S.19A of the Act that the Act and Scheme apply only to certain sections of the respondent's establishment.
Whether the award of the Industrial Tribunal in I.T. No. 29 of 1960 precludes the demand for provident fund contributions.
Whether the Employees' Provident Funds Act, 1952 applies to all sections of the respondent's composite factory establishment.

petitioner_arguments.text: No decision under S.19A; letters of Aug 19,1959 and Sep 21,1959 were provisional/tentative pending SC appeal against Bombay HC judgment.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Employees' Provident Funds Act, 1952, S.19A; Regional Provident Fund Commr v. Shree Krishna Metal Mfg Co.

petitioner_arguments.text: Act applies to entire composite establishment including all sections.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Employees' Provident Funds Act, 1952, S.1(3), S.2A; Regional Provident Fund Commr v. Shree Krishna Metal Mfg Co.

petitioner_arguments.text: Industrial Tribunal award has no relevancy; appellants not parties; statutory duty to enforce Act independent of award.
Demand for contributions and admin charges justified post-SC decision.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Employees' Provident Funds Act, 1952, S.6, S.7A

respondent_arguments.text: Letters Aug 19,1959 (Central PF Commr) and Sep 21,1959 (RPFC) constitute final decision under S.19A that Act applies only to Lantern/Stoves and Enamel sections; refunds made.
Industrial Tribunal award (Jun 24,1960) adjudicated liability for period in question; binding, precludes demand.
Even post-SC decision, Act does not apply to all sections as S.2A effective only from Dec 31,1960.

court_reasoning.text: Act applies to composite factories like respondent's; all sections covered, as held in Shree Krishna case; S.2A reference was emphatic, not determinative for pre-1960 period.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Manufacture of glass, enamel, lanterns/stoves is industrial activity; decision squarely applies.

court_reasoning.text: No S.19A decision; letters provisional due to Bombay HC judgment pending SC appeal; entire correspondence shows tentative nature; post-SC, demand justified.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Department bound by HC till reversed; no fresh doubt post-judgment for S.19A.

court_reasoning.text: Tribunal award irrelevant to statutory liability; appellants not parties; Act imposes mandatory contributions at statutory rate for employee welfare.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Award based on losses, not Act; give credit for any payments made under award.

court_reasoning.text: Admin charges payable as employer liable for contributions.

holdings.text: No final decision under S.19A; provisional only pending SC; post-SC reversal of Bombay HC, Act/Scheme apply to all sections.
Tribunal award does not bar statutory demand; credit for payments made thereunder.
Demand of May 22,1963 justified; employer liable for contributions + admin charges Nov 1,1952-Dec 31,1960 at statutory rates.

precedents_cited.case_name: Nagpur Glass Works Ltd. v. Regional Provident Fund Commissioner
precedents_cited.relevance: Held Act applies only to scheduled sections in composite factory; reversed by SC.

precedents_cited.case_name: Regional Provident Fund Commissioner, Bombay v. Shree Krishna Metal Manufacturing Co., Bhandara
precedents_cited.relevance: Act applies to composite factories; all departments/employees covered.

statutes_cited.name: Employees' Provident Funds Act, 1952
statutes_cited.relevance: Applicability to establishments; contributions at 6-1/4%; power to remove doubts; statutory liability enforced.

outcome.summary: SC allowed appeal, set aside Bombay HC judgment/order dated Sep 17,1965; dismissed writ petition; appellants entitled to costs.
outcome.relief_granted: Demand of May 22,1963 upheld; realize dues giving credit for Tribunal award payments.
outcome.costs: Appellants entitled to costs in appeal.

key_quotes.text: "the Act applies to composite factories and that the Glass Works therein was commercially engaged in a Scheduled industry among others and hence the Act was applicable to it."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Holding from Shree Krishna case applied to respondent.

key_quotes.text: "There has been no final decision taken by the Central Government under S.19A of the Act regarding non-applicability of the Act and the Scheme in respect of the three sections."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "the award in I.T. No. 29 of 1960 does not stand in the way of the appellants demand."
key_quotes.speaker: court
